http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A derivation is a transformation of an entity into another, an update of an entity resulting in a new one, or the construction of a new entity based on a pre-existing entity.

http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/descript.@value:
IRRIG is an ontology specified for modeling data from a decision support system (DSS) experimented in UR1471 TSCF - Research Unit Technologies and Information Systems for Agrosystems, INRAE, center Clermont Ferrand. The DSS automatize the IRRINOV©, a manual irrigation method build by Arvalis and their partners. 
The website of TSCF: https://www6.ara.inrae.fr/tscf/

http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/title.@value: Irrigation ontology for experimentation in TSCF

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: AmountProperty - Amount or quantity aspect of an entity. The amount aspect of an entity is intrinsic and cannot exist without the entity. The value of the amount should be expressed by a qualitative value such as a state or by a quantitative value.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: RainQuantity is an AmountProperty representing the amount of rain.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: CropGrowthDeduction - A defined class that represents the act of carrying out a procedure to estimate the state of the growth property for the crop entity. The growth property is represented by the individual irrig:observableProperty_crop_growth. The crop entity is represented by the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_crop. Two necessary and sufficient conditions are defined: (1) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:observableProperty_crop_growth via the sosa:observedProperty object property; (2) All instance of this class are linked to the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_crop via the sosa:hasFeatureOfInterest object property. Additionally, each instance of this class is linked to an instance of the class irrig:CropGrowthState by the caso:hasResultState object property, is linked to an instance of the class irrig:CropGrowthObservation by the prov:wasInformedBy object property, and is linked to a sensor to describe the agent that made the deduction.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A CropGrowthDeduction is made by an inference engine based on human observation.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: CropGrowthObservation - A defined class that represents the act of carrying out a procedure (observation) to estimate the value of the growth property for the crop entity. The growth property is represented by the individual irrig:observableProperty_crop_growth. The crop entity is represented by the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_crop. Two necessary and sufficient conditions are defined: (1) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:observableProperty_crop_growth} via the sosa:observedProperty object property; (2) All instance of this class are linked to the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_crop} via the sosa:hasFeatureOfInterest object property. Additionally, each instance of this class is linked to a sensor to describe the agent that made the observation.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A CropGrowthObservation that made by a famer called John Doe.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: CropGrowthState - A qualitative value of the crop growth property, which changes over time, summarising a set of information about that property. To evaluate the state of the property, some boundaries need to be defined.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A state V2 is linked to an individual of the CropGrowth property dedicated to maize crop. The state V2 is reached when two leaves have fully emerged with collars visible in a maize plant.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: CropWaterNeedDeduction - a defined class represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate a State of the irrig:ObservableProperty_crop_waterNeed of the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_crop. The Observation may be performed by an inference engine. Links to a State to describe what the result is. Links to a TemporalEntity to indicate when the result is valid and for how many time.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A CropWaterNeedDeduction that made by an inference engine based on the state of the other properties such as RainIntensity property.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: CropWaterNeedState - A qualitative value of the crop water need property, which changes over time, summarizing a set of information about that property. To evaluate the state of the property, some boundaries need to be defined.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: The state No of the crop water need Property represents the fact that the crop does not need water.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: DelayDurationObservation - a defined class that represents act of carrying out a procedure (observation) to calculate the number of delay days of the duration property for the delay entity. Delay days are the number of days that the system postpones the schedule. The duration property is represented by the individual irrig:observableProperty_delayDuration. The delay entity is represented by the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_delay. Two necessary and sufficient conditions are defined: (1) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:observableProperty_delayDuration via the sosa:observedProperty object property; (2) All instance of this class are linked to the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_delay} via the sosa:hasFeatureOfInterest object property. Additionally, each instance of this class is linked to a sensor to describe the agent that made the observation.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A delay duration to postpone the irrigation schedule is two days.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: GrowthProperty - Growth aspect of an entity representing the physical development or the increasing of amount, number, or size of the entity. The growth aspect of an entity is intrinsic and cannot exist without the entity. The growth quality should be expressed by a qualitative value such as a state or by a quantitative value.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: CropGrowth is a growth property representing the development of a crop.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: IntensityProperty - Intensity aspect of an entity, that is,  the strong effect or the level of power per unit area of the entity. The intensity aspect of an entity is intrinsic and cannot exist without the entity. The intensity quality should be expressed by a qualitative value such as a state or by a quantitative value.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: RainIntensity is an intensity representing the strength of rain.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: IrrigationActuation - Act of carrying out an Irrigation (Actuation) Procedure to change the State of a Moisture ActuatableProperty of a Soil FeatureOfInterest using a watering Actuator. This act is performed during the context exploitation phase of a context aware system. Links to an Actuator to describe what made the Actuation and how; links to an ActuatableProperty to describe the target that the Actuation change; links to a FeatureOfInterest to detail what that property was associated with. When the act is performed based on a Deduction, it should be linked to this Deduction by the wasInfluencedBy property. Links to the Function that is triggered by the Actuation.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: An IrrigationActuation is made by Watering Valve Actuator, links to Soil30cmDepth FeatureOfInterest and its Soil30cmDepthMoisture ActuatableProperty.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: MoistureProperty - Moisture aspect of an entity representing the amount of water available inside the entity. The moisture aspect of the entity is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the entity. The moisture quality should be expressed by a qualitative value such as States or by a quantitative value.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: RootZoneMoistureLevel is a MoistureProperty representing the amount of water available around the soil’s root zone area of a plant.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RainQuantityObservation - a defined class that represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of the irrig:ObservableProperty_rain_dailyTotalQuantity of the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_rain. This act can be performed during the context acquisition or context processing phases of a context aware system. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to the irrig:ObservableProperty_rain_dailyTotalQuantity to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_rain. When the act is made during the context processing phase the entry values of the procedure should be linked to the Observation by the wasDerivedFrom property.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A RainDailyTotalQuantityObservation is based on observations made by an aggregator.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RainIntensityBoundary - Limit of a state of the rain intensity property. The value of the limit is quantitative. The irrig:boundaryValue data property is used to store this value.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: 10 mm is the value of the low boundary that distinguishes the light state from the moderate state of the rain intensity property.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RainIntensityDeduction - a defined class that represents act of carrying out a procedure to estimate the state of the intensity property for the rain entity. The intensity property is represented by the individual irrig:observableProperty_rain_intensity. The rain entity is represented by the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_rain. Two necessary and sufficient conditions are defined: (1) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:observableProperty_rain_intensity via the sosa:observedProperty object property; (2) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_rain via the sosa:hasFeatureOfInterest object property. Additionally, each instance of this class is linked to an instance of the class irrig:RainIntensityState by the caso:hasResultState object property; is linked to an instance of the class irrig:RainDailyTotalQuantityObservation by the prov:wasInformedBy object property; and is linked to a sensor to describe the agent that made the deduction.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A RainIntensityDeduction that made by an inference engine based on observations made by an aggregator.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RainIntensityState - Qualitative value of the rain intensity property, which changes over time, summarizing a set of information about that property. To evaluate the state of the property, some boundaries need to be defined.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: The state Light of the RainIntensity property represents the fact that the rain has no impact on irrigation decisions.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RainQuantityObservation - A defined class that represents the act of carrying out a procedure (observation) to estimate the value of the quantity property for the rain entity. The quantity property is represented by the individual irrig:observableProperty_rain_quantity. The rain entity is represented by the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_rain. Two necessary and sufficient conditions are defined: (1) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:observableProperty_rain_quantity via the sosa:observedProperty object property; (2) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_rain via the sosa:hasFeatureOfInterest object property. Additionally, each instance of this class is linked to a sensor to describe the agent that made the observation.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A RainQuantityObservation that made by a pluviometer.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RootZoneDailyAverageMoistureObservation - A defined class that represents the act of carrying out a procedure (observation) to estimate the value of the daily average moisture property for the root zone entity. The daily moisture property is represented by the individual irrig:observableProperty_rootZone_dailyAverageMoisture. The root zone entity is represented by the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_rootZone. Two necessary and sufficient conditions are defined: (1) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:observableProperty_rootZone_dailyAverageMoisture via the sosa:observedProperty object property; (2) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_rootZone via the sosa:hasFeatureOfInterest object property. Additionally, each instance of this class is linked to a sensor to describe the agent that made the observation.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A RootZoneDailyAverageMoistureObservation is computed by an aggregator.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RootZoneMoistureLevelBoundary - Limit of a state of the root zone moisture level property. The value of the limit is quantitative. To store this value, the irrig:boundaryValue data property is used.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: 10 cbar is the value of the very high tension boundary that distinguishes the saturated state from the very high state of the RootZoneMoistureLevel property.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RootZoneMoistureLevelDeduction - A defined class that represents the act of carrying out a procedure to estimate the state of the moisture level property for the root zone entity. The moisture level property is represented by the individual irrig:observableProperty_rootZone_moistureLevel. The root zone entity is represented by the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_rootZone. Two necessary and sufficient conditions are defined: (1) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:observableProperty_rootZone_moistureLevel} via the sosa:observedProperty object property; (2) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_rootZone via the sosa:hasFeatureOfInterest object property. Additionally, each instance of this class is linked to an instance of the class irrig:RootZoneMoistureLevelState by the caso:hasResultState object property; is linked to an instance of the class irrig:RootZoneDailyAverageMoistureObservation by the prov:wasInformedBy object property; and is linked to a sensor to describe the agent that made the deduction.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A RootZoneMoistureLevelDeduction that made by an inference engine based on observations from an aggregator.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RootZoneMoistureLevelState - Qualitative value of the root zone moisture level property, which changes over time, summarizing a set of information about that property. To evaluate the state of the property, some boundaries need to be defined.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: The saturated state of the RootZoneMoistureLevel Property represents a fact that the moisture in the root zone is saturated with water.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: SleepingDurationObservation - A defined class that represents the act of carrying out a procedure (observation) to calculate the number of sleeping days of the duration property for the sleeping entity. Sleeping days are the number of days that the system needs to wait until the next turn of doing an action. The duration property is represented by the individual irrig:observableProperty_sleepingDuration. The sleeping entity is represented by the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_sleeping. Two necessary and sufficient conditions are defined: (1) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:observableProperty_sleepingDuration via the sosa:observedProperty object property; (2) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_sleeping via the sosa:hasFeatureOfInterest object property. Additionally, each instance of this class is linked to a sensor to describe the agent that made the observation.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A sleeping duration for the next irrigation is eight days.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Soil30cmDepthDailyAverageMoistureObservation - A defined class that represents the act of carrying out a procedure (observation) to estimate the value of the daily average moisture property for the soil at 30 cm depth entity. The daily average moisture property is represented by the individual irrig:observableProperty_soil30cmDepth_dailyAverageMoisture. The soil at 30 cm depth entity is represented by the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_soil30cmDepth. Two necessary and sufficient conditions are defined: (1) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:observableProperty_soil30cmDepth_dailyAverageMoisture via the sosa:observedProperty object property; (2) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_soil30cmDepth via the sosa:hasFeatureOfInterest object property. Additionally, each instance of this class is linked to a sensor to describe the agent that made the observation.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Soil 30cm Depth Daily Average Moisture Observation

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A Soil30cmDepthDailyAverageMoistureObservation is computed by an aggregator.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Soil30cmDepthDailyAverageMoistureObservation - A defined class that represents the act of carrying out a procedure (observation) to estimate the value of the moisture property for the soil at 30 cm depth entity. The daily average moisture property is represented by the individual irrig:observableProperty_soil30cmDepth_moisture. The soil at 30 cm depth entity is represented by the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_soil30cmDepth. Two necessary and sufficient conditions are defined: (1) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:observableProperty_soil30cmDepth_moisture via the sosa:observedProperty object property; (2) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_soil30cmDepth via the sosa:hasFeatureOfInterest object property. Additionally, each instance of this class is linked to a sensor to describe the agent that made the observation.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A Soil30cmDepthMoistureObservation is made by a tensiometer placed at 30 cm depth in the soil.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Soil60cmDepthDailyAverageMoistureObservation - A defined class that represents the act of carrying out a procedure (observation) to estimate the value of the daily average moisture property for the soil at 60 cm depth entity. The daily average moisture property is represented by the individual irrig:observableProperty_soil60cmDepth_dailyAverageMoisture. The soil at 60 cm depth entity is represented by the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_soil60cmDepth. Two necessary and sufficient conditions are defined: (1) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:observableProperty_soil60cmDepth_dailyAverageMoisture via the sosa:observedProperty object property; (2) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_soil60cmDepth via the sosa:hasFeatureOfInterest object property. Additionally, each instance of this class is linked to a sensor to describe the agent that made the observation.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Soil 60cm Depth Daily Average Moisture Observation

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A Soil60cmDepthAverageDailyMoistureObservation is made by an aggregator.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Soil60cmDepthDailyAverageMoistureObservation - A defined class that represents the act of carrying out a procedure (observation) to estimate the value of the moisture property for the soil at 60 cm depth entity. The daily average moisture property is represented by the individual irrig:observableProperty_soil60cmDepth_moisture. The soil at 60 cm depth entity is represented by the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_soil60cmDepth. Two necessary and sufficient conditions are defined: (1) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:observableProperty_soil60cmDepth_moisture via the sosa:observedProperty object property; (2) All instances of this class are linked to the individual irrig:featureOfInterest_soil60cmDepth via the sosa:hasFeatureOfInterest object property. Additionally, each instance of this class is linked to a sensor to describe the agent that made the observation.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A Soil60cmDepthMoistureObservation is made by a tensiometer placed at 60 cm depth in the soil.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: StressProperty - Stress aspect of an entity, that is, the pressure inside the entity. The stress aspect of an entity is intrinsic and cannot exist without the entity. The stress quality should be expressed by a qualitative value such as a state or by a quantitative value.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: CropWaterNeed is a StressProperty representing the stress inside the plant when it needs extra water.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: TemperatureProperty - Temperature aspect of an entity. The temperature aspect of an entity is intrinsic and cannot exist without the entity. The temperature quality should be expressed by a qualitative value such as a state or by a quantitative value.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: AirTemperature is a TemperatureProperty representing the temperature value of the air.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Actuator_wateringValve_1 - An actuator n°1 that controls the valve of water.

Boundary_rain_quantity_high - a boundary line of division between two states of Rain Intensity: Heavy and Moderate.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rain quantity high is 40mm.

Boundary_rain_quantity_low  - a boundary line of division between two states of Rain Intensity: Moderate and Light.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rain quantity low is 10mm.

Boundary_rain_quantity_maximum - a boundary line represents the maximal value that rain quantity cannot surpass.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rain quantity maximum is 90.0mm (even more than the word record which is 71.8mm)

Boundary_rain_quantity_maximum - a boundary line represents the minimal value that rain quantity cannot below.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rain quantity minimum is 0mm.

Boundary_rootZone_tension_average - a boundary line of division between two states of RootZone MoistureLevel: Low and Average.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension average is 140.0 cbar or 1400.0 mbar.

Boundary_rootZone_tension_high - a boundary line of division between two states of RootZone MoistureLevel: Average and High.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension high is 120.0 cbar or 1200.0 mbar.

Boundary_rootZone_tension_low - a boundary line of division between two states of RootZone MoistureLevel: VeryLow and Low.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension low is 150.0 cbar or 1500.0 mbar.

Boundary_rootZone_moistureLevel_maximum - a boundary line represents the maximal value that RootZone Tension cannot surpass.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension maximum is 301cbar or 3010 mbar (even more than the possible value of Watermark can evalute which is 300 cbar).

Boundary_rootZone_moistureLevel_minimum - a boundary line represents the minimal value that RootZone Tension cannot below.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension minimum is 0 cbar or 0 mbar.

Boundary_rootZone_tension_saturation - a boundary line of division between two states of RootZone MoistureLevel: VeryHigh and Saturated.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension saturation is 10.0 cbar or 100.0 mbar.

Boundary_rootZone_tension_veryHigh - a boundary line of division between two states of RootZone MoistureLevel: High and VeryHigh.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension very high is 70.0 cbar or 700.0 mbar.

Boundary_rootZone_tension_veryLow - a boundary line of division between two states of RootZone MoistureLevel: Dry and VeryLow.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension very low is 160.0 cbar or 1600.0 mbar.
FeatureOfInterest_air - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents air.

FeatureOfInterest_crop - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents crop. The crop needs to be irrigated. 

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the crop is maize that growth in an Arvalis' plot in 2013.
FeatureOfInterest_delay - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents delay phenomenon.
FeatureOfInterest_rain - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents rain.
FeatureOfInterest_rootzone - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents rootzone soil of a plant.
FeatureOfInterest_sleeping - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents sleeping phenomenon.
FeatureOfInterest_soil30cmDepth - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents soil at 30cm depth.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Feature Of Interest Soil at 30cm Depth

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: FeatureOfInterest_soil30cmDepth - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents soil at 60cm depth.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Feature Of Interest Soil at 60cm Depth

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_air_dailyMaxTemperature - an instance of the class irrig:TemperatureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of max temperature per day of an air feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Air Daily Max Temperature

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_air_dailyMinTemperature - an instance of the class irrig:TemperatureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of min temperature per day of an air feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Air Daily Min Temperature

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_air_temperature - an instance of the class irrig:TemperatureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of temperature of an air feature of interest.
ObservableProperty_crop_growth - an instance of the class irrig:GrowthProperty and caso:Property that represents the observable property of growth of a crop feature of interest.
ObservableProperty_crop_stage - an instance of the class irrig:GrowthProperty and caso:Property that represents the stage observable property of a crop feature of interest.
ObservableProperty_crop_waterNeed - an instance of the class irrig:StressProperty and caso:Property that represents the observable property of water need of an crop feature of interest.
Number of days that an watering is delayed.

ObservableProperty_rain_dailyTotalQuantity - an instance of the class irrig:AmountProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of total quantity per day of a rain feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Rain Daily Total Quantity

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_rain_intensity - an instance of the class irrig:IntensityProperty and caso:Property that represents the intensity observable property of a rain feature of interest.
ObservableProperty_rain_quantity - an instance of the class irrig:AmountProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the quantity observable property of a rain feature of interest.

ObservableProperty_rootZone_dailyAverageMoisture - an instance of the class irrig:MoistureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of average moisture per day of a root zone feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Root Zone Daily Average Moisture

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_rootZone_moistureLevel - an instance of the class irrig:MoistureProperty and caso:Property that represents the observable property of moisture level of a root zone feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Root Zone Moisture Level

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Number of days that the system is waiting until the next irrigation.

ObservableProperty_soil30cmDepth_dailyAverageMoisture - an instance of the class irrig:MoistureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of average moisture per day of a soil 30cm depth feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Soil 30cm Depth Daily Average Moisture

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_soil30cmDepth_moisture - an instance of the class irrig:MoistureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of moisture of a soil 30cm depth feature of interest.

ObservableProperty_soil60cmDepth_dailyAverageMoisture - an instance of the class irrig:MoistureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of average moisture per day of a soil 60cm depth feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Soil 60cm Depth Daily Average Moisture

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_soil60cmDepth_moisture - an instance of the class irrig:MoistureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of moisture of a soil 60cm depth feature of interest.
Pluviometer_1 - a pluviometer measures the rain quantity n° 01.
Pluviometer_2 - a pluviometer measures the rain quantity n° 02.
SoilTensiometer_1_30cm - a soil tensiometer measures the moisture at 30 cm depth n° 01.
SoilTensiometer_2_30cm - a soil tensiometer measures the moisture at 30 cm depth n° 02.
SoilTensiometer_3_30cm - a soil tensiometer measures the moisture at 30 cm depth n° 03.
SoilTensiometer_4_60cm - a soil tensiometer measures the moisture at 60 cm depth n° 04.
SoilTensiometer_5_60cm - a soil tensiometer measures the moisture at 60 cm depth n° 05.
SoilTensiometer_6_60cm - a soil tensiometer measures the moisture at 60 cm depth n° 06.
State_crop_growth_init - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the state of crop growth is temporary undefined.
State_crop_growth_r1 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop after reaching the “silking” stage. This stage is also named R1.
State_crop_growth_r1d15 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop 15 days after reaching the “silking” stage.
State_crop_growth_r5 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop after reaching the “dent stage within kernel containing 50% moisture”. This stage is also named R5
State_crop_growth_r5hg45 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop after reaching the “dent stage within kernel containing 45% moisture”.
State_crop_growth_v2 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop after reaching the crop stage “5 leaves”, also named V2.
State_crop_growth_v7 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop after reaching the crop stage “10 leaves”, also named V7.
State_crop_growth_v7d20 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop 20 days after reaching the stage “10 leaves”.
State_crop_waterNeed_init - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the state of crop water need is temporary undefined.
State_crop_waterNeed_no - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop does not need water.
State_crop_waterNeed_notApplicable - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the state of crop water need has not been evaluated yet.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Crop Water Need Not Applicable

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: State_crop_waterNeed_unavailable - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop may need water soon.
State_crop_waterNeed_yes - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop needs water.

State_rain_intensity_heavy - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the rain intensity is heavy.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, this RainIntensity property reaches this state the open upper boundary is RQ_maximum and the close lower boundary is RQ_high.
State_rain_intensity_init - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the rain intensity is temporary undefined.

State_rain_intensity_light - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the rain intensity is light.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, this RainIntensity property reaches this state the open upper boundary is RQ_low and the close lower boundary is RQ_minimum.

State_rain_intensity_moderate - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the rain intensity is moderate.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, this RainIntensity property reaches this state the open upper boundary is RQ_high and the close lower boundary is RQ_low.

State_rootZone_moistureLevel_average - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the average state.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, this RootZoneMoistureLevel property reaches this state the open upper boundary is ST_average and the close lower boundary is ST_high.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Average

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value:
State_rootZone_moistureLevel_dry - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the dry state.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, this RootZoneMoistureLevel property reaches this state the open upper boundary is ST_maximum and the close lower boundary is ST_very_low.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Dry

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value:
State_rootZone_moistureLevel_high - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the high state.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, this RootZoneMoistureLevel property reaches this state the open upper boundary is ST_high and the close lower boundary is ST_very_high.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level High

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: State_rootZone_moistureLevel_init - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is temporary undefined.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Init

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value:
State_rootZone_moistureLevel_low - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the low state.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, this RootZoneMoistureLevel property reaches this state the open upper boundary is ST_low and the close lower boundary is ST_average.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Low

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value:
State_rootZone_moistureLevel_saturated - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the saturated state.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, this RootZoneMoistureLevel property reaches this state the open upper boundary is ST_saturated and the close lower boundary is ST_minimum.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Saturated

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value:
State_rootZone_moistureLevel_veryHigh - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the very high state.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, this RootZoneMoistureLevel property reaches this state the open upper boundary is ST_very_high and the close lower boundary is ST_saturated.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Very High

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value:
State_rootZone_moistureLevel_veryLow - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the very low state.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, this RootZoneMoistureLevel property reaches this state the open upper boundary is ST_very_low and the close lower boundary is ST_low.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Very Low

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A sensor that measures the rain fall.
A sensor that measures the soil moisture.
A sensor that measure weather conditions.
An actuator that open the water valve.
A relationship identifying the manufacturer of an entity (e.g., device)
A relationship identifying the model of an entity (e.g., device)
A relationship providing the name of an entity (e.g., device)
